title: Tiger

| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [monst.c#line381](/wiki/Monst.c#line381 "Monst.c") |

A **tiger**, f, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a large, quadrupedal [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") that is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision") like all felines, and is the most powerful of the [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

A tiger has two claw attacks and a moderately powerful bite.

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") certain types of [food](/wiki/Food "Food") while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating") and [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a tiger results in [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM").[\[1\]](#cite_note-tonytiger-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [6.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [7 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated tigers are always created hostile.

## Strategy

Tigers move at the same speed as an unhasted, unburdened [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") - this makes them somewhat easier to avoid compared to the faster felines, and its lack of [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") renders it very vulnerable to magic. Its attacks can still be dangerous to an unprepared adventurer, but a moderately armored and/or well equipped one can dispatch it without much trouble.

## History

The tiger first appears in [NetHack 3.0.6](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.6 "NetHack 3.0.6").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Tiger](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger "wikipedia:Tiger")***

The tiger (*Panthera tigris*) is the largest living cat species and a member of the genus Panthera - it is most recognisable by its dark vertical stripes on orange-brown fur with a white underside. Tigers are apex predators that primarily prey on ungulates such as deer and wild boar; they are territorial and generally solitary, but social predators. The tiger was first scientifically described in 1758, and is among the most recognizable and popular of the world's megafauna; it is the national animal of India, Bangladesh, Malaysia and South Korea.

Tigers were once widespread over much of Asia's landmass some centuries ago; today, the tiger is an endangered species due to habitat destruction, habitat fragmentation, poaching, and human–wildlife conflict. Its habitat range stretches from Siberian temperate forests to subtropical and tropical forests on the Indian subcontinent, Indochina and Sumatra. Tigers featured prominently in the ancient mythology and folklore of cultures throughout its historic range, with many symbolic depictions continuing to the modern day.

The YAFM displayed when eating meaty food while hallucinating and polymorphed into a tiger is based on the motto for the [Frosted Flakes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frosted_Flakes "wikipedia:Frosted Flakes") cereal brand, whose mascot is [Tony the Tiger](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_the_Tiger "wikipedia:Tony the Tiger").

## Messages

- This <[foo](/wiki/Foo "Foo")> is gr-r-reat!

  You were hallucinating while polymorphed into a tiger and ate meat (such as a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")).[\[1\]](#cite_note-tonytiger-1)

## Variants

Some [variants](/wiki/Variants "Variants") change the tiger's glyph to keep it distinct from other feline monsters that they introduce.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), tigers can generate in [real zoos](/wiki/Real_zoo "Real zoo").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Weretigers](/wiki/Weretiger "Weretiger") summoning help have a 1⁄5 chance of generating a hostile tiger on each applicable square[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)—a hero that gets lycanthropy from a weretiger can summon tigers as pets with the same probability by using the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"), which costs 10 [power](/wiki/Power "Power").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the tiger is the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster for [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"), and makes up 96⁄175 (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Caveman quest](/wiki/Caveman_quest "Caveman quest"). Tigers also appear among the random f that are part of the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for the Caveman quest and make up 6⁄175 (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), the tiger's glyph is changed to f, and its level and [difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") are increased.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), tigers have a 1⁄100 chance of dropping a [tiger eye ring](/wiki/Tiger_eye_ring "Tiger eye ring") upon death.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Gladiators](/wiki/Gladiator "Gladiator") can obtain gold by killing tigers.

As in UnNetHack, the tiger is the first quest monster for Cavepeople, and makes up 96⁄175 (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest. Tigers also appear among the random f that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest and make up 6⁄175 (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there. Additionally, tigers appear among the random f that are part of the first quest monster class for [Zookeepers](/wiki/Zookeeper "Zookeeper") and make up 24⁄175 (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [Zookeeper quest](/index.php?title=Zookeeper_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zookeeper quest (page does not exist)").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the tiger's glyph is changed to f, and they have a 1⁄100 chance of dropping a tiger eye ring upon death as in xNetHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

1\. A well-known tropical predator (\_Felis tigris\_): a feline. It has a yellowish skin with darker spots or stripes. 2. Figurative: \_a paper tiger\_, something that is meant to scare, but has no really scaring effect whatsoever, (after a statement by Mao Ze Dong, August 1946).  
\[ Van Dale's Groot Woordenboek der Nederlandse Taal ]  
  
Tyger! Tyger! burning bright  
In the forests of the night,  
What immortal hand or eye  
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?

\[ The Tyger, by William Blake ]

## References

1. ↑ [1.0](#cite_ref-tonytiger_1-0) [1.1](#cite_ref-tonytiger_1-1) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1717](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L1717)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [mkroom.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 802](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mkroom.c#line802 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mkroom.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [were.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 144](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/were.c#line144 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/were.c")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Tiger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
f tiger
Difficulty 8
Attacks Claw 2d4, claw 2d4, bite 1d10
f tiger
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Claw 2d4, claw 2d4, bite 1d10

Base level 6
Base experience 73
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 600
Nutritional value 300
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A tiger:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line381

A tiger, f, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a large, quadrupedal feline that is carnivorous and can be seen via infravision like all felines, and is the most powerful of the monster class.

A tiger has two claw attacks and a moderately powerful bite.

Eating certain types of food while hallucinating and polymorphed into a tiger results in YAFM.[1]

Generation

Randomly generated tigers are always created hostile.

Strategy

Tigers move at the same speed as an unhasted, unburdened hero - this makes them somewhat easier to avoid compared to the faster felines, and its lack of MR score renders it very vulnerable to magic. Its attacks can still be dangerous to an unprepared adventurer, but a moderately armored and/or well equipped one can dispatch it without much trouble.

History

The tiger first appears in NetHack 3.0.6.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Tiger

The tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest living cat species and a member of the genus Panthera - it is most recognisable by its dark vertical stripes on orange-brown fur with a white underside. Tigers are apex predators that primarily prey on ungulates such as deer and wild boar; they are territorial and generally solitary, but social predators. The tiger was first scientifically described in 1758, and is among the most recognizable and popular of the world's megafauna; it is the national animal of India, Bangladesh, Malaysia and South Korea.

Tigers were once widespread over much of Asia's landmass some centuries ago; today, the tiger is an endangered species due to habitat destruction, habitat fragmentation, poaching, and human–wildlife conflict. Its habitat range stretches from Siberian temperate forests to subtropical and tropical forests on the Indian subcontinent, Indochina and Sumatra. Tigers featured prominently in the ancient mythology and folklore of cultures throughout its historic range, with many symbolic depictions continuing to the modern day.

The YAFM displayed when eating meaty food while hallucinating and polymorphed into a tiger is based on the motto for the Frosted Flakes cereal brand, whose mascot is Tony the Tiger.

Messages

This <foo> is gr-r-reat!
You were hallucinating while polymorphed into a tiger and ate meat (such as a corpse).[1]

Variants

Some variants change the tiger's glyph to keep it distinct from other feline monsters that they introduce.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, tigers can generate in real zoos.[2]

Weretigers summoning help have a 1⁄5 chance of generating a hostile tiger on each applicable square[3]—a hero that gets lycanthropy from a weretiger can summon tigers as pets with the same probability by using the #monster extended command, which costs 10 power.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the tiger is the first quest monster for Cavepeople, and makes up 96⁄175 (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest. Tigers also appear among the random f that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest and make up 6⁄175 (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, the tiger's glyph is changed to f, and its level and difficulty are increased.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, tigers have a 1⁄100 chance of dropping a tiger eye ring upon death.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, Gladiators can obtain gold by killing tigers.

As in UnNetHack, the tiger is the first quest monster for Cavepeople, and makes up 96⁄175 (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest. Tigers also appear among the random f that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest and make up 6⁄175 (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there. Additionally, tigers appear among the random f that are part of the first quest monster class for Zookeepers and make up 24⁄175 (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Zookeeper quest.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, the tiger's glyph is changed to f, and they have a 1⁄100 chance of dropping a tiger eye ring upon death as in xNetHack.

Encyclopedia entry

1. A well-known tropical predator (_Felis tigris_): a feline. It has a yellowish skin with darker spots or stripes. 2. Figurative: _a paper tiger_, something that is meant to scare, but has no really scaring effect whatsoever, (after a statement by Mao Ze Dong, August 1946).
[ Van Dale's Groot Woordenboek der Nederlandse Taal ]

Tyger! Tyger! burning bright
In the forests of the night,
What immortal hand or eye
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?

[ The Tyger, by William Blake ]

References

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1717
  2. ↑ mkroom.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 802
  3. ↑ were.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 144

A '''tiger''', {{monsym|tiger}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a large, quadrupedal [[feline]] that is [[carnivorous]] and can be seen via [[infravision]] like all felines, and is the most powerful of the [[monster class]].

A tiger has two claw attacks and a moderately powerful bite.

[[Eating]] certain types of [[food]] while [[hallucinating]] and [[polymorph]]ed into a tiger results in [[YAFM]].{{refsrc|src/eat.c|1717|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name="tonytiger"}}

==Generation==
Randomly generated tigers are always created hostile.

==Strategy==
Tigers move at the same speed as an unhasted, unburdened [[hero]] - this makes them somewhat easier to avoid compared to the faster felines, and its lack of [[magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] renders it very vulnerable to magic. Its attacks can still be dangerous to an unprepared adventurer, but a moderately armored and/or well equipped one can dispatch it without much trouble.

==History==
The tiger first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.6]].

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Tiger}}
The tiger (''Panthera tigris'') is the largest living cat species and a member of the genus Panthera - it is most recognisable by its dark vertical stripes on orange-brown fur with a white underside. Tigers are apex predators that primarily prey on ungulates such as deer and wild boar; they are territorial and generally solitary, but social predators. The tiger was first scientifically described in 1758, and is among the most recognizable and popular of the world's megafauna; it is the national animal of India, Bangladesh, Malaysia and South Korea.

Tigers were once widespread over much of Asia's landmass some centuries ago; today, the tiger is an endangered species due to habitat destruction, habitat fragmentation, poaching, and human–wildlife conflict. Its habitat range stretches from Siberian temperate forests to subtropical and tropical forests on the Indian subcontinent, Indochina and Sumatra. Tigers featured prominently in the ancient mythology and folklore of cultures throughout its historic range, with many symbolic depictions continuing to the modern day.

The YAFM displayed when eating meaty food while hallucinating and polymorphed into a tiger is based on the motto for the [[wikipedia:Frosted Flakes|Frosted Flakes]] cereal brand, whose mascot is [[wikipedia:Tony the Tiger|Tony the Tiger]].

==Messages==
{{message|This <[[foo]]> is gr-r-reat!|You were hallucinating while polymorphed into a tiger and ate meat (such as a [[corpse]]).<ref name="tonytiger"/>}}

==Variants==
Some [[variants]] change the tiger's glyph to keep it distinct from other feline monsters that they introduce.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], tigers can generate in [[real zoo]]s.{{refsrc|mkroom.c|802|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

[[Weretiger]]s summoning help have a {{frac|5}} chance of generating a hostile tiger on each applicable square{{refsrc|were.c|144|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}—a hero that gets lycanthropy from a weretiger can summon tigers as pets with the same probability by using the [[Monster (command)|#monster]] [[extended command]], which costs 10 [[power]].

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], the tiger is the first [[quest]] monster for [[Cavepeople]], and makes up {{frac|96|175}} (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Caveman quest]]. Tigers also appear among the random {{white|f}} that are part of the second [[quest]] monster class for the Caveman quest and make up {{frac|6|175}} (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], the tiger's glyph is changed to {{red|f}}, and its level and [[Monster difficulty|difficulty]] are increased.

===xNetHack===
In [[xNetHack]], tigers have a {{frac|100}} chance of dropping a [[tiger eye ring]] upon death.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[Gladiator]]s can obtain gold by killing tigers.

As in UnNetHack, the tiger is the first quest monster for Cavepeople, and makes up {{frac|96|175}} (55%) of the monsters randomly generated on the Caveman quest. Tigers also appear among the random {{white|f}} that are part of the second quest monster class for the Caveman quest and make up {{frac|6|175}} (3%) of the monsters randomly generated there. Additionally, tigers appear among the random {{white|f}} that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Zookeeper]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} (14%) of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Zookeeper quest]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, the tiger's glyph is changed to {{orange|f}}, and they have a {{frac|100}} chance of dropping a tiger eye ring upon death as in xNetHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==

1.  A well-known tropical predator (_Felis tigris_): a feline.  It has a yellowish skin with darker spots or stripes.  2.  Figurative: _a paper tiger_, something that is meant to scare, but has no really scaring effect whatsoever, (after a statement by Mao Ze Dong, August 1946).
[ Van Dale's Groot Woordenboek der Nederlandse Taal ]

Tyger! Tyger! burning bright
In the forests of the night,
What immortal hand or eye
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?
|[ The Tyger, by William Blake ]
